questions.question: What are the three required elements of an artificial neural network (ANN)?

options.A: Input layer, output layer, decision tree
options.B: Input layer, hidden layers, output layer
options.C: Input node, bias node, output node
options.D: Feature selector, hidden layer, output node

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which statements about the input, hidden, and output layers of an ANN are correct?

options.A: Input layer size is determined by the number of features
options.B: Hidden layers and nodes per layer are chosen by the user
options.C: Output layer size depends on the prediction task
options.D: Hidden layers must always have more nodes than the input layer

questions.question: What is the main function of an activation function in a neural network node?

options.B: To transform the weighted sum of inputs before passing to the next layer
options.D: To split the data into batches

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which are common activation functions used in ANNs?
Why is it generally recommended to start with a small neural network and expand as needed?

options.A: Smaller networks are less likely to overfit and easier to train

sections.title: Section 2: Training and Optimization in ANNs

questions.question: What is the purpose of the forward pass in neural network training?

options.B: To propagate input data through the network and compute predictions
options.C: To split data into training and validation sets

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which steps are part of the standard ANN training process?
What is the role of the learning rate in neural network training?

options.A: It determines the number of layers
options.B: It controls the size of weight updates during training

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which statements about backpropagation are correct?

options.A: It uses the computed gradient to update weights
options.B: It is repeated until convergence or a maximum number of iterations
options.C: It only updates the bias term

questions.question: Why is splitting data into training and validation sets important when training an ANN?

options.A: It helps tune hyperparameters and assess model generalization
options.B: It increases the number of features
options.C: It reduces the need for activation functions
